title: Insurance Denial Causes Patient Conflict
summary: Insurance denied coverage for a completed procedure; the patient demands the office adjust the bill. Clarify financial policies with empathy and strengthen financial communication.

scene.setting: Insurance denied coverage for a completed procedure. The patient demands the office adjust the bill; the front desk feels attacked. The decision point is deflect or educate transparently.

beats.narration: The patient is upset; the front desk needs support. The decision point is deflect responsibility or educate with empathy.

dialogue.speaker: lead
dialogue.line: I want to explain what happened and what options you have. Can we sit down with the EOB?

choices.label: Blame the insurance company and tell the patient to call them.

steps.step: Same-day: explain denial calmly, show EOB, offer payment options.

leader_lines: Let me walk you through what happened and what we can do.
questions: What would improve how we explain this next time?
scripts.closing_line: Transparency and one option we can offer.

choices.label: Explain the denial calmly, show the EOB, and offer payment options.

steps.step: Explain denial, show EOB, offer payment options.
Identify one training or script for front desk (denials, policy).

leader_lines: Here's what happened. Here are your options.
questions: What training would prevent future conflict?
scripts.closing_line: Policy in writing; script for denials.

choices.label: Offer a one-time discount to keep the patient happy.

steps.step: Document exception and criteria; communicate policy for next time.

leader_lines: We can do this once. Here's our policy going forward.
questions: What's our clear policy for next time?

choices.label: Escalate to the manager and avoid answering directly.

steps.step: Define escalation path and script so front desk can own the conversation.

leader_lines: Front desk will own this with backup. Here's the path.

system_prompts.nudge: Transparency builds trust even when news is bad.

outcomes.message: The patient may still feel passed around. Clarity was delayed.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with one clear explanation?
How does front desk own the conversation?

outcomes.message: The patient understood; relationship preserved. Financial communication is stronger.
reflection_questions: Which script or policy helped most?
How do you train on difficult conversations?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week we clarified financial policy with empathy. (1-5)
